messageBody:
RE: Help

>   Date: Tue, 11 Sep 2001 10:46:40 +0100
>   From: "Pankaj Solanki" <psolanki@...>
>Subject: Help
>
>Hi All,
>
>Will anyone plz inform me how to write test cases (not necessarily white box, at the
>moment even black box technique will be OK) for following scenarios:

The magic word is "please" not "plz".

>(1) To test the connectivity and file transfer between AS/400 and Unix machine.
>
>    Input : Flat file (ASCII format)
>    Output : EBCDIC format

void testAs400ToUnix() throws Exception
{
    As400 ibm = new As400();
    File asciiFile = new File( "ascii.txt" );
    ibm.acceptForTransfer( asciiFile );
    Unix sun = new Unix();
    ibm.doTransfersTo( sun );

    File ebcdic = sun.getTransferredFile();
    File expectedEbcdic = new File( "expectedEbcdic.txt" );
    assertTrue( FileUtils.filesEqual( expectedEbcdic, ebcdic );
}

>(2) To test the connectivity and file transfer between RS 6000 and Unix machine.
>
>    Input : XML file
>    Output : XML file

see above code example

>(3) To test the connectivity and file transfer between BAAN and Unix machine.
>
>    Input : XML file
>    Output : XML file

see above code example

>Thank you very much
>
>Pankaj
